description:
This place is awesome. The breakfast is way better than Mel's drive - in or Denny's . The three egg omelette is ample enough to keep a big eater like me full. The has browns is a must have item as your side dish. The most important part is the prices are reasonable for the amount and quality of food you get. I would highly recommend my friends to come in and dine here. 

Just remember eat like a pig, this is a place for you. Enjoy. You won't be disappointed.
author: A S.

description:
Basically the Clement Street equivalent of gas station sushi. It's 4:00am after eating dinner at this dump last night, and I'm writing on behalf of my own intestines as well as my daughter's. It's too late for us. Save yourself. Find a 7-11 and nuke a frozen burrito before going to this place.

Hostess was nice. They only take cash (I guess their accounting is as dodgy as their cooking), and the in-house ATM went out of service when I was in the middle of using it.

I used to be better than this. I don't know where I went wrong in life but I hope tonight is the end of my penance.
author: Ryan J.

description: This is a cute old diner, something from 50s and I like it! I can appreciate the beauty of old school spot and the usual diner food. It has about 20 single bar seats and about 2 seater short booths with a little room in the back for larger group, by all means, the place is very small but cozy. Food is pretty good in size and taste, by far better and much cleaner than Mel's Drive-In on Geary, it's just tight on parking and it's mostly meter.
author: Natalie G.

description: Place is old school with leather booths with great burgers! Good area, nice atmosphere. Nice server.
author: T G.

description: Love supporting local places and businesses but I was sadly disappointed from the last time I remember being here.. My eggs Benedict was way overdone on the egg, French toast had no flavor and everything was dry and bland. I wish it was better and I could like it.. The waitress didn't even ask if everything was okay or not.. Just came to take the order, drop the food, and then the check. Can't say I'll be back..
author: Terilyn T.

description: I mean, breakfast is just so solid. Love sitting at the counter and seeing the b-fast chef do his thing. The man cracks like 5 eggs at a time!! Hash browns are so crisp on outside and soft on inside. Omelettes are huge. Staff is friendly. Into it.
author: Christa C.

description:
Awesome burgers. Great Soup!
Got a Jalapeño burger and it was simply fantastic. 
Great service and homey environment.
author: sergey V.

description: Great brunch spot on Clement! Classic no-frills diner with the usual diner fare - waffles, pancakes, eggs, etc. I love having this decidedly un-trendy option in the inner Richmond. If you want to wait in line, go somewhere else! The staff is friendly and attentive too, and the prices are super reasonable. So glad to have finally made it here... Will definitely be back! They serve dinner as well. Support your old school San Francisco establishments!
author: Jason H.

description: Love this spot. I try and make it here when I'm visiting from LA. The Country Irish is my go to favorite!
author: Johnny R.

description: Have been going for decades.  Good diner food.  A once a week breakfast regular for us (get the weekday breakfast special). Everyone there is friendly.  Say hi to the 'Joses'
author: D N.

description:
Really good food with really friendly service. I had the chicken sandwich melt and it was very good. I may be the last person in America to enjoy, actually seek out, cole slaw; theirs was tasty.

Weird to have a "diner" in the middle of Clement St, but hey it works. Old style counter and small tables for two.
author: E F.

description: Great deluxe Burger . Value and great service in an old San Francisco institution. I will definitely come here again.
author: Juan V.

description: This is a nice, friendly burger and breakfast place. *** Cash Only *** so come prepared.
author: Bob L.

description:
Back in the day Robin Williams would grab a burger here. Incognito and with that silly grin on his face...

I like Hamburger Haven because it's like walking into a burger joint decades ago, d'oh since 1968, and no it's not a chain but has survived the fast-food boom, & lately the fancy burger spots *pinky up!* It's just steady, Freddy!

Located on Clement St. & 9th Ave. in the inner richmond district it is convenient for all. As you enter you'll notice the rustic decor mixed-in with a greasy spoon aura. The over-stuffed forest green stools fixed at the bar & the forest green booths whispers the 1970's. Framed photos of the owners, local celebrities, and some iconic faces of yesteryear scatter the walls as well. It's not fine dining by any means, but it's comfortable. Almost like at Grannies! 

I usually sit at the booth even if riding solo, unless it's a weekend then I'll slide over to the bar. I'm by no means a regular, however have been here several times and have my go-to's on the menu. I used to love the French Dip w/ Au Jus Special (not sure if it's still offered tho), the breakfast deals are good too (several to choose from, but the weekday special is the best), and of course it would be sacrilege to not have a fav burger here, so mine was the Haven Burger (1/3 burger, sautéed mushrooms, avo, grilled onions, jack cheese) or the Mushroom Swiss Cheeseburger. All comes with fries & potato salad or coleslaw. And vegheads don't fret... there are 3-types of vege burgers! So, although it's an old burger joint, the menu is more like a roadside diner... lot's to choose! 

Hamburger Haven is by no means my favorite burger joint, but it's comfort to me. I know what to expect... A good burger or meal at diner prices. I have no problem returning next time, just glad smoking was outlawed years ago... 'cause the walls still smell so, Mary! The free nostalgia and quirkiness added bonus. 

RIP Robin! Ketchup later...
author: Eric R.

description:
Whoa!  I randomly looked up this burger spot because my auntie used to take me here as a kiddo and low and behold this place still exists after so many years!

So, this review is based on burger nostalgia.

Looking at the yelp photos, I can tell they still do burgers just as they did back in the day.  There are the perfectly toas
ted buns and nicely charred burgers.  I remember the burgers to be so delicious and juicy.  The dining area from current photos look clean and not much has changed in a few decades. 

For those that live in the Richmond District of San Francisco, you are fortunate to a have a classic burger spot at Hamburger Haven!

Thank you, Auntie for taking me to the best burger places as a kid!!!
author: Lilah D.

description:
This place was our go to diner. We used to live near by and we will visit for weekend breakfasts or for a burger. We still visit after our move to Daly City. 

They offer pretty good breakfast and burgers. It is a simple diner with good customer service. 

The waitress there will remember you after couple times, which is always a nice touch. 

I recomment their burgers if you are looking for a simple, non-pretentious burger. I personally think it is hard to find a diner around the bay area without getting wait staffs and menus that are not pretentious.
author: Tomomi T.

description:
Came here like 10 years ago and again a few days ago.

Quick service.  Your basic old school diner.  I like it cause it's like time stood still.  They refilled my aunt's coffee every time they passed by almost, but she can drink strong coffee so if you don't want a refill put a cover on it.

It's simple so don't be trying to grade it like it's fine dining.  It filled me up when I was hungry and I didn't see any bugs and it didn't look dirty to me.  I don't need a fancy breakfast where I have to wait an hour to get seated and have garnish I don't plan on eating.

The only bugger is that it's CASH ONLY!
author: Gia C.

description: The service was good, but the eggs Benedict left me disappointed. The hollandaise was bland, I had to add salt. The house potatoes were soggy, but the coffee was decent. My peaches also came after I was half way through my food, but that doesn't matter, I am not fond of peaches. The employees were very friendly, and that is the one thing that was a good. The food left me, unsatisfied.
author: Nikki O.

description:
Have been here several times for breakfast on the weekend and I highly recommend! The service is amazing and there is rarely a wait.

The food is okay for the price. The place is clean. Just a good cheap neighborhood place.
author: Rose E.

description: Love this little diner in the Inner Richmond in SF. Known for their hamburgers, but my wife and I like to visit them during the weekend for their breakfast menu. Our favorite place is sitting at the counter facing the cook and his wares. We've met some very friendly people here and continue with say hello to the regulars. It's always nice to walk into this establishment and be quickly recognized by the staff. Feels like a close knit community here. Food is delicious diner food whether you come here for breakfast, lunch or dinner. They have a a good sized menu to choose from and everything is good.  Looking forward to my next return which might be this Saturday :)
author: Patrick W.

description: Great breakfast joint. Everyone is friendly and if you come enough, the workers will start to get to know you. While I was sitting, the workers talked to many customers and it seemed like they've know each other for years. Definitely a good, home-y vibe here. I got the Joe's special, which was a ground beef, spinach scramble. It was delicious. It also comes with hash-browns and toast or a muffin. The small complaint I have, is that the hash-browns were a bit oily for my taste. Other than that, great place. I would definitely be coming back soon!
author: Justin H.

description: Stopped in for brunch today. Had the California omelette. Everything was fresh and yummy. Just good food done well.
author: Bobbie D.

description: My favorite diner in the city. No frills diner food with friendly service. I particularly like their steak and eggs. I see other reviews on here expecting more out of this place... it's an old diner with diner food and it hits the spot. Not sure it falls within the foodie category that requires much critique.
author: Donnie K.

description: Great veggie burger! I love their food and service much more than Mells Diner.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
I liked my burger so much last week that I wanted to try their Breakfast. This morning, I had their Irish Breakfast, which consists of 2 eggs, 2 slices of Irish Bacon, 2 Irish sausages, hash browns, and toast.

I've never been to Ireland, but the Irish bacon is similar (or identical) to the bacon I've had in the UK, so it's a lot more meatier and tastes like ham.  The Irish sausage seemed similar to a British Banger - it seemed have some breadcrumbs mixed in with the pork. 

At any rate, i was very happy with my breakfast, so i recommend Hamburger Haven for burgers and for breakfast.
author: Allen T.

description: the burgers are VERY dry and bland. from the looks of it it's probably frozen patties.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Love this place!!! Great classic comfort food, excellent friendly and fast service. Though dated or shall we say original, the decor is oddly perfect for this sweet little diner.   Those retro green chairs are super comfy.

I've got a family of picky eaters and each and every one of them is always happy when they've had a meal here.
author: Jane V.

description: Stopped in by chance and what a wonderful surprise! Sandwiches fresh and tasty, service prompt and friendly. Best tuna melt EVER says my friend.  Reasonable prices.
author: Sandy B.

description:
I've been eating here since I emigrated from Southern California 33 years ago. My husband has been eating here since he was a kid. It's a diner, not a cafe, not a bistro, not an artisanal bakery/butcher. They have real hash browns, not home fries, and for this alone they are worth a visit. We usually eat late breakfast, but sometimes a burger for lunch. The burgers have actually improved since the eighties, but they are burgers, nothing fancy. 

Enjoy the photos of Robin Williams hanging with the staff, and the friendly but not obsequious waitstaff. If we stay away too long we always get a nice acknowledgement. It's like going to a home town diner in a small town, which is really what is so great about San Francisco. Don't go in expecting to grill the waitstaff about ingredients and technique, it's not that kind of place, thankfully.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Better than many places I went !, but for that price you can get something good.
Taste is OK.
Nice and friendly service.
author: Vicky D.

description: I've been coming to Hamburger Haven for the past 5+ years with my dad and my brother. We are regulars and the waitress (Asian one) always knows our exact order. We don't even pick up the menu anymore. :) The staff is also incredibly attentive to pouring coffee! The food is your basic diner food, nothing fancy or exceptional about it. But the welcoming staff are what keep me and my family going back every weekend for breakfast.
author: Meagan C.

description: Ok. Upgrading to 4 stars. The burger really is deserving, and my son confirmed it. So here it is :)
author: Massimo M.

description:
Pros
-Delicious food
-Inexpensive (especially relative to Mel's!)
-Polite staff will tend to you quickly

Cons
-Cash only

This place is stupendous!
author: Dominic P.

description:
I'm sure I've passed by Hamburger Haven over the years without ever taking notice. I was probably on my way to a far trendier eatery ready to dine with hipsters half my age and twice as obnoxious. However, a moment of sheer spontaneity brought Jamie W. and me here as we impulsively boarded the 2-Clement on Market Street and took it to the end of the line around 12th Avenue. Strolling on Clement, we noticed how quiet the place was, and that appealed to us at that very moment. Once you enter, you feel like you're in an Edward Hopper painting with lonely-looking souls eating by themselves.

We parked ourselves in a two-seat booth along the wall and perused a menu that offered no less than 24 different hamburgers. Jamie went for his old stand-by, the $8.95 Patty Melt, which was exactly what it was supposed to be, a burger with grilled onions and melted jack cheese squeezed between two slices of toasted rye (see photo). Me, I felt an obligation to try the $9.50 Haven Burger, presumably the house special with avocado, sautéed mushrooms, grilled onions and melted jack cheese atop a medium-rare burger (see photo). It wasn't amazing, but it was good, solid comfort food. Plenty of fries came with both of our burgers, and they were moist on the inside with a nice crunch on the outside.

But even before my burger and fries, I had a $1.95 cup of their Chicken Rice Soup (see photo). Piping hot but comforting on a cold night. No complaints about the food whatsoever. It was exactly what Jamie and I wanted that evening. All the time we were there, there was barely a change in the clientele. Two solitary diners left, two more came in, usually being very chatty with the cook who looks like he's been manning the grill for quite sometime. Service was very low-key but attentive. Some of the daily specials they had listed sounded tempting like their Pork Roast on Tuesdays and their Shredded BBQ Pork Sandwich on Wednesdays, which I assume they make from the leftover pork from Tuesday. Yep, it's a no-frills, comfort-food diner alright.

FOOD - 4 stars...delivers the quality you expect and then some
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...formica and naugahyde like ebony and ivory
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...like I said, low-key but definitely present
TOTAL - 4 stars...an unpolished gem of a greasy spoon if you ask me
author: Ed U.

description:
This place has been here for as long as I can remember, and I wish I would have walked in here sooner! I'm not a big burger fan, so I just assumed that's all they sold here. But they serve so much more! It's your typical diner, and they serve breakfast, burgers (of course), sandwiches, and salads. 

This place is so quaint, and my server was very nice. She checked up on me and made sure I had everything I needed. 

I came here for dinner and opted to get the haven burger. It came with grilled onions, mushrooms, avocado, and cheese, and it was really yummy. I chose the side of fries, which would have been better if they were salted. 

I am definitely coming back here!
author: Rachel H.

description: Hamburger Haven is such a cute diner! Their interior gives off a warm & cozy vibe, (with really cute yellow windows in the back!) but their spacing between tables & such is borderline cramped (that's probably San Francisco in general) to the point it reminded me of being inside a train. Unfortunately, they charge extra for coffee refills. I ordered waffles & bacon, their bacon being perfect by not being too salty, but the waffles were mediocre. Overall, this diner is nice to experience & is very cozy, but I wouldn't be excited to go again.
author: Jade L.

description:
You know that old school, mom and pop establishment, that's been in your neighborhood for as long as you can remember? Hamburger Haven is one of those establishments. It's a no nonsense spot that has that "grandma's kitchen" vibe.

If you're looking for your run of the mill american breakfast spot, Hamburger Haven is going to be your best choice in the Inner Richmond neighborhood.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Generally speaking when you walk into an establishment that still does not take credit cards you sometimes have that worried and wondering feeling whether or not you have enough to pay. Noticeably some places have a minimum before you can use your plastic card but that is not the case here.

Additionally decor around the restaurant itself looks very dated as Pre-New Kids On The Block dated...

However the menu itself is actually much more expansive than what you would find at Dennys or IHOP. And buy expensive I mean the quality here is better than going to a sh*t  24 hour cholesterol joint like those mentioned above.

Irish Break fest Check. Bacon Eggs Hashbrowns and a shake....Check...Double burgers and Bacon.. Check..
Coke....Check...

And also for the early birds like me. The (younger) waitress that is here doesn't have that bitter and resentful contentious look that many of those who work at IHOP or Denny's seem to give off...

She's actually pretty friendly and decent looking compared to those other Lost-In-Transition drones you usually come across...

1)Bacon is cookies thoroughly but not the point where you're eating brick chips. Not undercooked so no health scare. (+1)

2)Egg scrambled NOT made from egg "concentrate" like some other laces that shall not be named again
(+1)

3) HashBrowns. Lightly grilled on the outside but everything holds together pretty well. No ketchup needed really unless its out of habit from dealing with the McDonalds variant. (+1)

Normally I am not fond of places whom resort to using Ocean Spray fruit juices...but its 8 in the morning.. too early for an early bird quality control ripping...

Additionally you don't get rushes out the door either so that's a good sign of a working management system too.

For those on the east bay who don't want to take the chance at crossing the bridge just to get here. Your Breakfast Equivalent would be either

1.Gillan Grill (customer service interaction would be degraded though judging from my last encounter)

2.Bistro 1491...No burgers here....

-----Speaking of dated...the Burger And Breakfast Quality is MUCH better here than Au CoQuelet in Berkeley though...that location hasn't changed since Nixon Got Iced....

However the only drawback for me about this place really is that the generally clientele are either current t or soon to be members of the golden girls club.haha...

Seeing some one of my age group here at times is the equivalent to saying the Raiders made it in to the playoffs.
author: Eric C.

description: Want some American style comfort good here it is. Not fancy and enough to fill your belly.
author: Unyo N.

description:
Local diner that's been open since the 60s? You bet we're gonna try it out.

My boyfriend LOVES diners. I feel like we're constantly on our own Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives episode. 

I've seriously seen Hamburger Haven my whole life. I just never went in. At first sight, it's a small and cute little diner space. But they keep it clean and it's relatively updated. We sat in the back room and had lukewarm coffee for the first cup. But I'll give it to them because they brewed a fresh pot without us mentioning it. 

Ordered two California omelettes, one with added mushrooms, the other with added spinach. They forgot to put bacon in one and were apologetic and brought out some hot chopped bacon. I ate them as chips :) GREAT SERVICE. Realizing a mistake before we even noticed. We also ordered the full french toast breakfast. But the best part of the meal? THE POTATOES. The bf said the country potatoes were great but I asked for some extra crispy hashbrowns, and they did NOT disappoint. I will seriously be back just for that. Prices aren't too high (which is what you're basically expecting nowadays in SF) and the food is really hot and good. 

Pro tip: 
Ask for extra crispy hash browns. 

TLDR:
Get the potatoes.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Good, cheap breakfast at a good, cheap price. Most important, the service is great and so incredibly friendly. Everyone from the owner, to the manager, to the cashier, to the wait staff, to the bus boy, and even the cook are warm and inviting and treat you like family. 

Plus I drink a ton of coffee at breakfast, and they're constantly filling my cup for me. Very important!

I used to go to Joe's Coffee Shop on Geary, which is very similar, but I literally stopped going there exclusively because their service was so incredibly surly.  SO glad I found Hamburger Haven instead!  (Especially after the closure of Lucky Penny, which I am still mourning!)
author: Frankie W.

description: This is a solid 4 star place. Fair prices , great service and an overall very comfortable experience. I enjoyed the variety of the menu also , from French toast to burgers to salads, hamburger haven has it all.
author: brittany g.

description:
I love the old diners with the coffee bar and swivel stools.
I had a mushroom Swiss burger, but the Swiss wasn't really Swiss. It was more like a strange creamy sauce.  Also, the menu said it was 1/3 lb, but it was more like half that. Very small.
Others had breakfast, which looked really really good.
Mimosas were advertised for $3.95 !! Weekend special, perhaps?
author: Julea D.

description:
The Haven burger was very good, service was very friendly but the server seemed either new or like she was just a friend of the restaurant helping out- she stood in the back room the entire time chatting and we had to flag her down- she was extremely nice nonetheless. The onion rings were pretty bad- flavorless and overly heavily breaded. Also did my fellow ranch ppl- it's the bottled kind here :/ 
I'd definitely return for a burger and fries and I'd love to try breakfast.
author: Emma H.

description: I love this place.   Fast service and good home fries.   Personally, i don't like strong coffee and they have the right kind of coffee for me.   Wonderful with all the weekday breakfast specials.  Senior discount 55+
author: D F.

description: This is a low-key diner. Period. You want some eggs? They have it. Some of the reviews on here are ridiculous. If you want a fancy brunch take yourself to Mama's or Zazies and stop dumping on the neighborhood hangover cure. Cash only.
author: Kayli B.

description:
I can't believe what just happened! We walked in at 8:10 pm, I asked if they were still opened.  Ordered and the waitress brought our food.  **nothing special.....coffee shop. 

Waitress so incredibly rude.  She served us, dropped the check and said "we close 8:30, can you pay now?" 
We paid her, continued eating and the second we were done she said "okay gentlemen, we're closed". 

Ridiculous! Why bother serving if you are going to rush the customer? 

**you can't really mess up hamburger steak.  The vegetables are frozen, over cooked and soggy but hey it is a hamburger shop.  She did allow me to change from potato to lettuce and tomato salad at no additional charge.  
Still her behavior was inexcusable.
author: bruce z.

description: Hamburger Haven is a great neighborhood diner with friendly staff. I stopped in recently for dinner. Although the restaurant was almost empty, a young mother with three young children sat at the counter. They were finishing their meals when I arrived. Although both the cook and the waitress interacted with the children as if they were regular customers, I don't think they were regulars. This is a great place for inexpensive, comfort food in a relaxing atmosphere. Senior discounts are given after five pm. Nice for us senior citizens.
author: Anita C.

description:
More like Hangover Haven.

New Year's Day around 3pm. Wanted/needed a diner. Finally stumbled upon Hamburger Haven.

Had chocolate chip pancakes, sausage, 2 over easy eggs and bottomless coffee. It was the perfect diner breakfast. That is all.
author: Jenna H.

description: The food is good, unpretentious. I mostly dig the unique 1970s/80s diner atmosphere, not the kitschy 50's variety.  Burnt orange and brown patterns, carpeted.  I duck in for a turkey burger every so often.  I believe it's family owned.  Happy to spend my money there.
author: J V.

description:
Food is standard diner fare, but exceptionally overpriced, though the weekday specials are a decent value.

 Breakfasts are anemic and are barely filling, yet have risen in price by up to $3.00 with no visible benefit. My shock came with a single waffle, doughy and undercooked, for $6.95 which has motivated us to walk a couple doors up to Ono Grindz and get our money's worth for Sunday breakfasts.

The burgers have suffered the same price/value inequality, but in their defense, the flavor was good and the lunch was filling and satisfying.

I gave an extra star for the service and friendliness, and it's neighborhood atmosphere we've enjoyed as a family for decades. I can imagine the price increases are a combination of factors, but the prices are on par for much better fare at other places just a few blocks away. 

All in all, it's the same restaurant but you'll spend 10-12 bucks more for the same family breakfast adventure, for the same food.
author: Edward P.

description: Cozy atmosphere, but bottom-quality ingredients make for blatantly shitty food without any pretense of quality.
author: Caleb B.

description:
This place was spectacular.  There aren't enough good words to describe how perfectly this resturaunt embodies the American diner experience.
Almost overly-attentive server. It was great.

And delicious.
And there's PIE.
author: Robin D.

description: Food is good and not too expensive! The place itself looks quite old. The staff however are very nice and extremely friendly.
author: Rebecca O.

description:
Hamburger Haven has the ambiance of a junior high school cafeteria. But you go for the awesome food and 'day-before-payday' type of prices. You know the feeling...

The cook in there is pretty amazing. He works alone behind the counter, serving it up with what seems to be a flurry of spatula-smacking, pot clanging movements. How does he do it? 

Service however is equivalent to asking for a favor from your annoyed aunt with a hearing problem. Excuse me? Excuse...um, can we get ketchup? Can we...nevermind I'll steal it from my neighbor's table.

Ugh. But it's okay - I don't expect much at a place where nearly every item on the menu is under $10. And the burgers are pretty legit.

But it wouldn't be a bad idea to bring your own ketchup packets...just saying :) 3.5 stars.
author: Mariela D.

description:
This place is great.  It's definitely a place where locals go to for reasonably priced food that's delicious.  The burgers are charbroiled and the fries are excellent.
There is nothing fancy about this place but that's what I love about it. I have yet to have breakfast here but the burgers are amazing! Remember, cash only.
author: Michelle A.

description: Let's go back to the basics! I love Hamburger Haven. It's an unpretentious diner where you can get basic breakfast and lunch. As much as I love trying out new places, I find that I always go back to these hole in the walls because these places do not try to distract you with the latest decor trend. The food is simple but good, and prices are reasonable. The service is always great. The ladies there are always happy to see you.  I highly recommend.
author: Katzi H.

description: From around the neighborhood and recently tried this place...again..then again..and then once more yesterday. Classic american diner kind of food. I love that i can sit and eat in front of the kitchen where my food is being made by the bad ass asian chef and his compadre. GREAT food..GREAT prices, classic.
author: Vee T.

description: The burgers are awesome and they have good onion rings too. I haven't tried other things on the menu yet but it looks good...
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Good old fashion breakfast place 
When you just want that classic American breakfast and singu
author: Seaera T.

description: Part of SF Inner Richmond history. No frills. Offering American fare such a breakfast, burgers, sandwiches. Casual, clean, fast, and excellent service. This is your standard old school cafe style American joint. Family owned and regulars are here on the daily!
author: Cherie F.

description: Great neighborhood old school cafe. It's been here forever, staff is friendly, yes they have WiFi and they serve breakfast all day. Thankfully, I'm within walking distance.
author: Sean P.

description:
After spending a day in SF with my fiancé, which ended at Ocean Beach, we decided we would like to eat a burger. We yelped and found Hamburger Haven. We got there maybe 40 mins before close and both ordered a burger. I was asked how I would like my burger, I said "rare." My fiancé ordered his "med rare." Both burgers which claim to be 1/3 lbs by the way came out well done. 

Service was nice, and even the old school decor...never changed carpet and seating seemed cool but 8.50-9.50 a burger and we both couldnt even get it to be done right.

I would have much rather have gone to In and Out and paid half that.

Sorry, not coming back.
author: Lynn C.

description:
The burger itself is good, nothing special, but good. On the other hand the service is among the worst I have ever seen. The waitress is unfriendly, didn't hand us the menu but asked twice if we were ready to order. 
I never wrote a review before but the lady serving the tables impressed me in a very bad way!
author: Leonardo L.

description: Great breakfast!!! The diner is small and nostalgic but the food is fantastic! I had the french toast full stack and sausage.. much better than eating at Dennys! Great prices too!
author: James L.

description:
I came to this diner this morning because I had an extra 30 minutes to kill.  I got their breakfast special which came with 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 bacon strips and added a side of hash browns.  I was able to share this with another person, and the bill only came up to $8.  

The food was decent, nothing special.  But, they were pretty fast.  I wouldn't mind coming here again.  It seems like they have their usual regulars that lounge there every morning.
author: Lynn L.

description: This is my go to place whenever I want to sit as long as I want, enjoy the great staff, have fantastic service.  This diner is great for casual meetings and casual friends' visits.  Most breakfasts served all day.  Really great place.  I'm relaxed as soon as I walk in the door.
author: Deb M.

description:
This a dive. A classic old school coffee shop diner dive with the sound of food grilling in the background and a huge counter. Feels like 1977. I think the last time they cleaned was 1978.

The hamburger was dry and flavorless and I couldn't finish it. Service is some of the worst in the city. 

Do not go here.
author: Justin S.

description:
Little Diner on the corner.  Good grub.  Had the patty melt and it was nice and greasy...grilled onions, everything that you want.

I sat at the counter and the server was very friendly.

They only take cash, but have an ATM right at the door!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
Hamburger Haven.....I totally love their breakfast here.  This place is like original.  

So I walked in, got greeted and seated myself at the counter.  (I love the sitting at the counter because you can watch the cook while he is cooking.)

I ordered the 2 Eggs, Hash Brown and a Hamburger Patty with an Orange Juice.

Eggs scrambled easy.

So as I sit waiting for my meal to come....you can see that the cook is completely focused on cooking.  You can tell that in his heart his desire is to get you that perfected meal.  He is just a single cook with many orders to fill and will toss out any unwanted or un-perfected meal.  No room for errors in this cook's  book.

When I got my meal....checked it out....PERFECTION!!  

Eggs were scrambled easy the way I like it.
Hash Brown were nicely cooked...brown on the outside...nice and warm on the inside...not overcooked or burnt.
My Hamburger Patty was also cooked just right ....Med. rare....nicely cooked on the outside and nice and juicy on the inside.
To have this topped of with a nice glass of Orange Juice.

Today I had the perfect breakfast....my only complaint about this place is that my waitress was slow and I felt wasn't very pleasant although it seems as she can be.

The place is good for single seating up to 6 people, more than 6 people you would have to be seated at two different tables.  Bathroom is kind of small....but the food makes up for all the little things.

This place gets my 4 Stars....5 Stars for the food....cooked to perfection!!

My breakfast spot!!  Will be back...
author: Alan L.

description: I came here on Friday and had the most tastiest burger ever. There sunrise burger is to die. Once you have one of these it ruins all other crappy burgers for you.
author: Brenda M.

description:
Side story.

Lunch: Turkey burger with a salad. Nothing too memorable. Asked for dressing on the side. Got the entire bottle. Amusing.

Breakfast: Poached eggs, muffin and a side of canned peach slices. Enjoyed. Also ham steak. Asked for chicken apple sausage instead. Got it. Appreciated.

Served in a greasy spoon no frills diner established in 1968. One man show cooking up the goods. Service is prompt and friendly. Priced just a bit too high ($10 - $13 total).

End of story.
author: Jason B.

description:
I was looking for a place to have brunch then read for a while...  Yelp came to the rescue and the next morning, I found myself at a little two seater with my new book.

The food is decent, the service is good, and the atmosphere is very casual and friendly.  

It was only AFTER I placed my order that I saw the cook pour the pancake batter on the griddle and I regretted not ordering a stack...  The best part of my brunch was the extra crispy hash browns and the endless cup of coffee.
author: Vicky P.

description: Typical diner. Ok if you are into comfort food. Too greasy for me. Coffee okay. Service was kind of slow in the beginning but maybe my blood sugar was just low and I was hungry. Nobody came by and asked how things were or refilled our coffee and water.
author: C H.

description: Love me a pancake breakfast. My bf likes the biscuits and gravy a lot. Morning weekend staff is awesome. Everything comes out fast. Sadly one time they didn't have meatballs when I Ordered spaghetti and meatballs for dinner but it's ok it happens. Their burgers are good.
author: Cynthia G.

description: This place is awesome.  Quick service, perfect hashbrowns, great hang-over breakfast.  Nuff said.
author: G W.

description:
Yum!  That is one solid, yummy burger.  My son and I each had the burger of our choice.  Mine, mushrooms, grilled onions,and cheese ( hold the avocado).

Don't come here if you want to be treated like a coolio neck-bearded hipster.  Or a richie rich dude.  Come here cuz you like dinner style, simple, no frills dinning and a solid burger.

The waitress will harass, but heck, harass back.  Have fun, you might get some exra fries! 

 And yes, my burger had the avocado I didn't want on it, and yes the waitress came and poked and pulled it off with a fork... and then ate it...  But who cares!?!?! 

Relax people!  Not everyone has to kiss your patootie!
author: Peter S.

description:
I had hamburgers there before... I thought they were good, but my opinion changes and will never go there again after a dinner.

Ordered a Salisbury steak [which I saw the cook mash up 2 hamburger patties], and the 'fresh veggies' and 'fresh mashed potatoes' were piled onto my plate from a bin, and then thrown into a microwave( right under the counter) .

How do I know? I was sitting on the counter, and watched the cook do it!


If you go here, maybe for the hamburgers... anything else... better off making something @ home...
author: Paul K.

description: This place can be counted on every time for a great meal. Prices are reasonable for the city.  They should get Coke. Right now they only have Pepsi.  Other than that it's great.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Everything I could ever want in breakfast cooked perfectly in a great old fashioned atmosphere and never ending coffee
author: Kyle F.

description:
It's a funny story actually, well for me it is! My boyfriend and I was just at school until we both decided to go to Genki's crepes on Clement St. When we finally arrived there, we both decided to cruise around clement and see what we can find here. I was starving, but eventually he did as well. We went back and fourth and passed Hamburger Haven twice but wasnt sure if we should eat there. But we both had that feeling that this place is good. and indeed it is!! 

I tried Bacon Hamburger with the side of fries! This burger was too perfect to be true, i mean...it really looks like a krabby patty from spongebob! lol the onions, lettuce, and tomatoes was neatly arranged on the right corner, fries were rich and golden, and hamburger was HEAVEN! it was delicious but too bad they do not accept card. boo! 

I couldnt understand the waitress, my boyfriend had to re-explain to me. But she does give me a welcoming feeling! Not only that, the place was cool! loved it!

5 stars for this restaurant :)
author: Christina B.

description: Closes earlier than expected. Standard diner fare, good service, cali burger favorite so far. For breakfast omelets are really good. Cash only but ATM on the inside.
author: David S.

description:
So I went here recently with my girlfriend and friend for breakfast. I heard about this place through my girlfriend and learned that Robin Williams has been to this place. Due to some information I became interested and decided to try the place out. 

Overall, it is a typical ol' school diner with stools, booths, coffee, and breakfast. Nothing really different from your stereotypical diner on tv. So if you are into a simple ol' school kind of vibe then this place might be good for you. 

As for the food, they were alright. They weren't terrible, but they also weren't memorable. They were simple and good if you just want a cheap breakfast fix. However, even though the food was okay, the service was great. The people who work there are super friendly and funny. They are not afraid to joke around or make small talk with the customers. I was especially surprised when their bus boy was talking Cantonese with some of the customer. The bus boy is Hispanic so I was surprised when hearing this. He later told my table that he was learning Cantonese at CCSF and felt that the best way to practice is to use it when having an opportunity. I give him major respect for that because he seemed very confident and friendly when trying it out. 

Therefore, even though the food and coffee wasn't great... I might come back one day due to the service and employees who work there.
author: Sonlay V.

description: The food was good. However the wait for our food was very very very long. Maybe it was a bad time or busy day, but it took like 45minutes from our order til being served. However the service was nice and kept out coffees cup full. Will keep at 3 stars til I revisit at another time.
author: Wilmer T.

description: Been going here for quite sometime, they are definitely improving! Breakfast wasnt the best a few years ago but now i LOVE it. The coffee is so yum and they give you a good amount of serving. Great hashbrowns, eggs, frenchtoast, and pancakes! I don't eat red meat anymore, but I bet it's great as well. My favorite is their breakfast menu, but i've yet to try their fish sandwich, which I'm going to try soon!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: I come to this place at least 4 times a week for breakfast. The reason is that they provide great service. I don't even have to ask to refill my coffee. They are very attentive to that. They remember who you are and what you always order. I am now a regular.
author: Rick A.

description: Small diner that serves diner quality food. I love watching the cook make breakfast so quickly in front of me when sitting at the diner. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my friend ordered a omelette. Both looked delicious when they were cooking. The Benedict came with peaches which was a nice addition. The place is cash only. Will probably come back in the mornings hungover on the weekend.
author: Jason L.

description: Classic American comfort food. Really great service. Super inexpensive. Go-to hangover cure.
author: Michelle W.

description: This place is a great little diner with good diner food. My favorites are their French toast and the veggie haven burger. The decor could be updated, but otherwise it's exactly what one would expect from a little local diner.
author: Apryl S.

description: Amazing Food! Really Good Prices! Gonna be back a lot! Nothing to complain about. Deserves 5 Stars!
author: Sebastian H.

description:
I fall more in love with this old timey diner every time I scarf down a plate of pancakes here. My family and I come here so often, Judy knows I like my butter on the side and that we need a table in the very back otherwise my son will run up and down the narrow front aisles beating his chest much like an escaped zoo monkey. I come here so often I told Jose I had to instill a "I won't eat pancakes here unless I run several miles first" rule because my jeans were pinching.

The coffee comes in one size, with no foam, in a ceramic coffee mug. If you want blue corn pancakes with maple brown butter, you've got the wrong joint! It's griddle cooking all the way...
author: Christina K.

description: This is the best breakfast joint I ever been to this year. The food is great, the people are nice, and the food is cheap. I am for sure that I am going to be here every week.
author: Ann Y.

description: My boyfriend and I come in once or twice a month for breakfast on the weekend.  It is often crowded, but I don't think we've ever had to wait for a spot to eat at the counter, which is really the best spot in the restaurant to sit!  From there you get to watch the one man show that is their chef.  It's amazing how much he can do all by himself on that food line!  The woman who always waits on is is also just the sweetest.  The food is okay.  I'm not big on breakfast, so I usually go for the tuna melt or a burger (good hangover cures).  Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for an inexpensive greasy food fix on Clement Street.
author: Mary F.

description:
Understaffed.
Makes it hard to get in and out in any reasonable amount of time in weekend mornings. 

However, the food is good. It's hard to botch eggs and bacon, true. But I've never been disappointed with the many times
I've had breakfast here.

The price is just a bit higher than id like considering the lack of service.
author: arthur l.

description:
This ordinary-looking diner is really a gem of the neighborhood, in a sea of Asian cuisine. Roughly $11 for a small (very small) orange juice and a country breakfast (2 biscuits with gravy, sausage links, bacon, and 2 eggs cooked to your choice).
Normally I wouldn't even come close to finishing a meal that large, but Haven caught me on a particularly famished day.
Cleanliness of the tables and window sills could improve (our table was very sticky), and there seemed to be only one cook for the entire restaurant, making our wait to eat roughly 30 minutes.
Besides that, servers are nice, on their game, and beer specials here are fantastic ($2 domestic beers, $3 imported beers).
author: Alyssa G.

description: Biscuits and gravy pretty rad.  The biscuit was fresh and the gravy wasn't  too chunky, just right. With a bit of tang to it.  Great wait service.  I would recommend for breakfast.   Much cleaner on the inside than it appears from out,  old style diner but the grill area behind the bar is really tidy.
author: Cary R.

description: No frills, old-school diner.  A gem in a city full of venture capitalist food.
author: Floyd B.

description:
Came here for birthday breakfast with my family.

Eggs Benedict were really tasty, perfectly cooked eggs
Corned Beef Hash was very disappointing, very dry, very salty, came as a patty
Irish Breakfast was pricey, but well worth it, and delicious
Pancakes, eggs, and bacon breakfast was a total steal and very good
French toast serving was small, but tasted good

There is not much staffing so the service is kind of slow. Super casual, old school diner seating. The food, over all was good.
I would definitely come back again to try other items on their menu.
author: Nancy F.

description:
1. Charming diner feel. 
2. Clean restaurant; dirty bathroom floor.
3. Low prices.
4. Good burger, but lettuce leaf was thick and rough like the leaf of a weed.
5. Mustard container was a jar...I wonder how many times that's been cross-contaminated.
6. Free soda refills...nice!
7. Strawberry milkshake was watery and lacked flavor...too much milk I guess. I think they use flavoring instead of real ice cream.
8. Cash only.

Bottom Line: I'll go back. There's something relaxing and charming about this place. It's not the best, but the prices are tough to beat for SF.
author: John W.

description:
Mmmmmm delicious....nuff said.

But no, the burgers here were absolutely scrumptious. I ordered The Royal, which came with bacon and a fried egg on a patty, while my Ma ordered the haven chicken burger, complete with some perfectly ripe avocado.

The Royal burger was at exactly the level of medium well I love and pssh, who doesn't love egg and bacon? Much less on a burger?

I had a bite of my Mas chicken burger and that too was fantastic. The chicken was nice and juicy and, as mentioned before, the avocado was ready for consumption.

We came during happy hour too and, being the nice daughter that I am I allowed my mom to get some 2 dollar Stella Artois. (BEST BEER EVER) ( Oh and I paid (and drove)). 

The waiter was nice albeit a little awk. He was some tall bald dude. 

DEF coming again. The place was both delish and cheap. A winning combo in my book, and the perfect place to go after a horrendous experience at Kaiser. (surprise, surprise)
author: Veronica D.

description: Love this place. Friendly staff, really good food, I've never once left this place unsatisfied.
author: Frank V.

description:
the burgers are very basic old diner style and kind of small, if you like a big juicy meaty burger this isnt the place, they only have the 1/3 pounder and looks small to medium after cooking

if you like the retro old school 1970's atmosphere you might like this burger joint, I doubt I would return, I can find much better burgers elsewhere, your better off going to Burger King in my opinion

the burgers are definitely just average, that must be why this place seems to never be very crowded, people dont line up at the door to get in or anything

havent tried the breakfasts yet, maybe next time I'll do an update on the breakfasts
author: Mr Bolo B.

description: Ordered a chicken teriyaki sandwich and it was pretty good. Little hole in the wall. Place only takes cash
author: Mandy S.

description:
Totally dependable and predictable for what you want in a diner.

Charming, clean, low prices- CASH ONLY.

Burgers are good.  Yes, when you order fish and chips it's frozen fish that's being fried, but what did you expect?  Still hits the spot when you need some good ol' diner food in the Richmond.
author: Christine K.

description:
Spontaneously decided to get dinner here after realizing that my original plan (clement street bar & grill) was closed for the day.

And boy am I glad that we did. They have $1 domestic and $2 imported beers in the evening and their burgers are pretty solid.  Service is very fast and they seem to have quite a few regulars, which is always a good sign.

And the fact that Robin Williams is a fan is pretty fantastic too.
author: Katie S.

description:
I love this place because its close to where i work. I havent gotten anything besides their burgers.  I have to say, their burgers are pretty good and they make it quite quick so i always have extra time to walk around clement before i go back to work.

However, today, the food doesn't taste that great.  My burger was semi burnt and they put too much mayonnaise.  Also, i saw the cook cough into a box of bacon.  I'm sure it was an accident, but that's disgusting. 

Their rug looks pretty dirty, i suppose that they haven't gotten their rug cleaned in awhile...
author: Tina L.

description: I don't understand how this place has decent reviews, especially in a city where there is no shortage of good food. The burgers, regardless of how we ordered them, all came out way past well done. Fries were nothing special, tasted like the frozen kind you get at Safeway. And same with the onion rings. Better off going to a fast food joint for a burger like that. Junk. I'm embarrassed that I made the suggestion to go here.
author: Melanie L.

description: Ive been going to hamburger haven since I was 5. Im 23 now and ive never had such a bad experience. I order togo since im busy. 25$ for two 9$ burgers?also she charged a ridiculous gratuity charge for a TAKEOUT order! Also the food was terrible. They have lost a lifelong customer.
author: Rawnie O.

description:
This place is both awesome and terrible at that same time...

First the good:

What a throw back!  I love the atmosphere here...  It's straight out of Reno circa 1970.  The decor is tastefully tacky.  The serving staff is super friendly and helpful.  My hamburger was indeed cooked medium as I had requested.

Now the bad:

Hamburger was not good.  I got the Double deluxe - two patties, two cheese.  It was frozen Costco patties I swear!  Bun was unremarkable.  Fries skimpy and not crispy (I think they were cooked to order, but just under cooked).

My dining partner's spaghetti was even worse.  Minimal sauce.  Sauce definitely came out of can and not much was done to it to hide the fact.  The can's label also probably said "Soup" and not "Sauce"...  

The bottom line:

I'm sure they serve decent food here as the place seemed to have a number of regulars - it's definitely not the hamburger (which is a tragedy for a place named Hamburger Haven) or spaghetti, though.  Despite the above, I would come back and give it another shot.  The decor is that good...  I think next time I'll try something off the breakfast menu.
author: Derrxck L.

description:
Meh.  I'd eat here again, but I wouldn't necessarily seek it out.  

Standard diner seating, decor, and food.  They have a ton of burger options on the menu, so that's good for variety's sake I suppose.  But between decent food, decent service, and mediocre atmosphere, it's not really great in any way.  

I initially was mesmerized by the family of flies chillin above the tables in the back.  So that probably wasn't a good sign.  Now I get it, flies are pesky and when doors are open they can get in and stay for awhile...I just don't really enjoy seeing them while I eat.  I then also felt bad for our waitress.  She was very nice, but she had messed up an order at the table next to us and then proceeded to have 2 mixups with our order.  Three of us ordered 3 burgers.  One standard cheeseburger, one haven burger minus avocado with cheddar instead of jack cheese (so that could get confusing, i see), and one California burger.  What came out were two standard cheeseburgers and a haven burger without avocado but with jack cheese instead of cheddar.  So I had to wait while they made me a California burger instead of the extra cheeseburger they brought out.  It wasn't too long of a wait, but it was a slight annoyance and we didn't bother exchanging the haven burger for one with cheddar instead.  

In terms of the food taste, the burgers were actually pretty solid.  Standard burger taste, good ingredients, overall pleasant.  I wasn't a huge fan of the fries though.  They were thicker, almost steak cut, and pretty crispy.  This may be a style of fries some people love, but I prefer thinner fries, better flavored fries, or those with a nice combination of crispy outside with a soft interior.  

So I'll eat here when the coworkers want to come again, but I doubt I'll bring anyone here on my own.  Cash only.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
STOMACH HELL!

Came here with my friend the other day to eat breakfast since we had to move the car for street cleaning at 7am. I ordered the benedict breakfast while he had pancakes, eggs sunny side up, sausage and of course our canned peach for fruit.

To start off, the coffee tasted old.

I have never ate benedict before but for $9, I can make 10 egg benedicts myself. It was a regular english muffin topped with a piece of canadian bacon and poached egg with some bland sauce on top. The hashbrowns weren't even cooked to crisp yet.

My friend on the other hand had the worst experience ever. Old coffee and uncooked pancakes was probably the reason why he had food poisoning and stomach pains for two entire days. He still can't eat regular food.


NEVER AGAIN!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
I haven't had hamburger at Hamburger Haven before.
Never had.
Only because i always had the $1.99 breakfast.
It was 25 years ago, 2 eggs+2 sausage+hash brown.
I remember the breakfast special went up to $2.99
Now, the menu is $4.99

I was also thinking that it'll be a Hell having a hamburger at Hamburger Haven. I don't know why I thought that. 
Hamburger Hell.
Hamburger Hell Kitchen.
But the place still calls Hamburger Haven.
So I got to get The hamburger.

The place still looks an American Diner type. 
It is narrow long restaurant with long counter seats.

I think that judging a good burger, It should be judging by Cheese Burger.
Nothing else but Cheese Burger because the other kind of burgers are add extra flavors like Teriyaki Burger or Hawaiian Burger as such.

I don't judge burger eating anything else but a cheese burger.
I think having a cheese burger tells you everything about what a happen in the kitchen when the burger was cooking, how the cook prepared?, How  the cook push and compressed the beef patty?, is the patty flat?, when the cheese put on, is the cheese melting? hows buns going?, etc.

A GOOD BURGER MUST TREATED RIGHT WAY.

And the place makes good hamburger.
1/3 lb beef.
I don't think it was a grass fed Angus  "Fxxxin' Kobe" beef as such.
Nothing fancy, Nothing gourmet about it but it was a good regular cheese burger.
I said it again.
IT WAS A GOOD JUICY REGULAR CHEESE BURGER.

That's what I needed
I don't need a fancy gourmet burger anyway.

Btw, the cook, I noticed the cook, he is the same guy who were making $1.99 breakfast special 25 years ago.
He didn't see me but, Goddamn he is still here!
He looks exact same as 25 years ago.
God bless him.

The Hamburger Haven is still my place.
author: Nobu K.

description:
First of all the guy taking our order can't do basic math WITH a calculator.  We already PAID FOR THE FOOD and were ready to leave when he said that he undercharged us and that we owed him an additional $7.00!!!  Granted, burgers are good and we went out of our way to eat this hole in the wall solely on the fact that Robin Williams ate there.  But in my humble opinion, you do not charge a customer, give them their food and then say they owe you more money!  He made the error and he should have accepted it as his mistake!  Will not be going back EVER!!!  

So to be straight on this... I rank the food at 4 stars and the service at 1 star with and average of TWO STARS.  I think that's a fair rating for the way I felt we were treated.  

If Hamburger Haven reads this they should remember that THE CUSTOMER IS ALWAYS RIGHT!!!!!
author: Mike M.

description:
This is an okay breakfast spot if you don't mind the chipped plates and the super greasy food.  The staff is certainly very friendly and the service is good.  I grabbed a counter seat over the weekend, ordered a breakfast omelet with juice, and I watched in enjoyment as the cook did his magic producing plate after plate of yummy-looking breakfast orders.  I know from watching him to avoid any bacon dishes in the future.  To skip the details I'll just say that I'd prefer the raw bacon to be stored more properly and to be cooked a bit longer.

My toast arrived in front of me long before my omelet and hash browns did which meant that the toast was already cold when my main platter arrived.  The Denver Omelet had big chunks of ham, diced red onions and green bell peppers seared together on the griddle and pocketed into a thin two-egg shell.  The hash browns were enormous and quite good grilled to a golden brown on both sides with a soft but not mushy inside.

The downside of the whole meal was having this odd "dirty oil" taste in my mouth afterwards.  Be sure to bring a mint or two before entering.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Local spot for dinner food that is actually below par for a denny's or ihop. Super cheap but I don't think you get what you pay for. Eggs benedict had brown gravey sauce in lieu of hollandaise. That was the red flag for me,. Don't plan on coming back and don't recommend when there are so many more places on Clement to go to.
author: Linda L.

description: This isn't a fancy place, but has a very old fashion diner feel! I loved the service and you can tell this place has it's regulars! My husband and I had a destination wedding in San Francisco and spent several days in the city and a local recommended we stop by Hamburger Heaven for Breakfast--and we both thought it was a great, non-commercial place. I would love to go back and actually try some of their hamburgers! We will definitely go back and visit next time we are in town!
author: C C.

description:
Two words: breakfast special.

2 eggs, 2 bacon/sausage, & 2 pancakes.  It's cheap on the weekends and ridiculously cheap during the week.  

We've only ever eaten breakfast there, but we go at least once a week with our daughter and sit at the counter.  Our toddler likes watching Tony, the cook, and he always makes her tiny little pancakes to go with her eggs...so nice.  

We see a lot of regulars and it's a great place for kids.  Jose, Judy, and the whole family who own/run the place are very nice.

Don't go here expecting top shelf mimosas and Prather Ranch meats.  This is a classic diner.  

Expect solid food and good coffee at great prices with friendly service.  It keeps us going back week after week.

Support this small family-run business!
author: Debra H.

description:
I'm a fan of diners and this is a good one. Their burgers aren't bad but their breakfast is awesome. The Country Special is so good I want to marry it.
They have a happy hour which is odd for a diner, but I want to check it out one of these days.
author: Geoff H.

description: Definitely my favorite diner place because of the food quality. Everything that I ordered was cooked to perfection and the waitress was friendly. I love it here and will definitely come back. Don't forget your cash! It's cash only.
author: Barry M.

description: This place has a fantastic brunch with some of the best Eggs Benedict I've ever had. The service was great and the food came out fast exactly as ordered. It's cash only, but that keeps the prices down and they've got an ATM on site. My only complaint was that it's not air conditioned, but I really think that's a minor issue. I have every intention of eating here again and I'd suggest it to anyone else too.
author: Eric M.

description:
Food is Denny's priced but the quality is worse - yes that's right - worse than Denny's. 

I like diners, I really do. However, I really dislike the idea of paying 8+ dollars for food that I can make at home ie wonderbread, safeway meat, and corner-store-vegetables.
author: Dorian T.

description: Cup of coffee and and omelette as you read the paper or a book. This place is a great spot to just come in and unwind. It's a little bit of a time machine, the place looks like it was decorated by Shelley Duvall in The Shining. But I like that sometimes.
author: Drew P.

description:
Hamburger haven. There is so much to say and not enough words. I love every employee with all my heart. And shout out to my boy Jose for being AMAZING! 
Their soup keeps me alive. And their breakfast has saved me from a lifetime of hangovers. Also, their bottomless coffees are fantastic too.
author: T D.

description: Exactly what I expect from a diner. Reminds me of growing up in a small Midwest town: none of which would be complete without a local diner. Decent quality burgers, fair prices, and friendly service. I got the California bacon burger, fries, and a root beer float, and I was quite satisfied with all of it.
author: Mark R.

description: This place didn't look like much to me, but it turned out to be a great eat! I ordered the cheeseburger (wo bread) and it was a nice, thin pattie, perfectly grilled. So moist and juicy and perfectly salted. I had the coleslaw with it and it was fresh with just the right amount of the white, gooey stuff. Avocado as a side was a perfect addition. Loved the presentation of the food (slice of tomato, picles, onion and lettuce) wich alowed for me to choose toppings for the burger. Great service and traditional interior. Fresh restroom. So glad we ended up here by chans. Next time I will order a dubble burger!
author: Agnes N.

description:
I'd give this place 4 stars if they took cards. The staff that works here are nice and the food is decent. And it's rare you can get a buger and fries in the city for under 10 bucks, but you can here...

I've been going to this joint for years and miss the salad bar they once had. 

Try a chicken burger if you're a meat eater =)
author: Zoeboe D.

description: This is my favorite breakfast spot in the 94118.  As others have mentioned, this is an old school diner.  All I ask for is good service and great food and they are spot on every single time.   Omelettes are perfect - not too dry or too runny.  Hash browns are about the size of my hand and perfectly crunchy.  Other places in the area may have all star chef or corporate ownership but for breakfast, this place is my favorite.  The staff takes care of me and gets me off to a good start in the morning, and that is not a small thing.
author: Re-pley Z.

description:
I am participating in a Winter Shape Up fitness and nutrition challenge. I came back to Hamburger Haven the day before this fitness challenge (which means no sugar, no white flour, no full fat dairy, no fried foods and no fatty meats) launched.

I got a cheeseburger with fries. Rarely has a meal been as satisfactory.

For the next 6 weeks it is broccoli and bench presses, but I'll have my memories of a perfect burger with cheddar and crispy, salty fries to propel me through.
author: Brittney G.

description:
Working in the Richmond has it's perks. Namely I can eat my way around the neighborhood and report back to all you sexy Yelpers. So one Saturday AM a few weeks ago I made the dummy mistake of misreading my schedule showing up early to work--an hour and a half early. My boss just alughed at me, did the once over and gave me some sage advice. Her words of wisdom?

"Go over to Hamburger Haven. They make a fabulous hangover breakfast."

Ok in my own defense the night before WAS a dear friend's birthday and yeah, my boss was (kinda) aware of my mischeivious potential and its not like a) I reeked of booze, b) I wore sunglasses, c) I was feverishly trying to remove bar stamps. But I'm all for testing remedies to temporary self induced aliments so on to Hamburger Haven I went.

Upon stepping inside, my first impression was classic diner with that '70's touch (dark wood, brown tiles, open kitchen). If I'd have seen ashtrays and non ironic trucker hats I'd have thought I stepped out of California. Even the photo of Robin Williams with who I assume are the owners and a young lady in a Hooters shirt doesn't distinguish the location as being in San Francisco. But  I observed that this little corner restaurant is a neighborhood spot as comfy as a pair flip flops in July. I watched patrons of all ages pop in with company, books and newspapers in hand, warmly greeted by the staff. I heard more than one cry of  "The usual?" from a staff member to a patron, followed by "Sit down, I'll get you your coffee".

About that coffee....not too shabby. Not exactly what I look for (my idea of good coffee is something rich in flavor and with enough caffeine in it to potentially cause heart palpatations) but let me share with you that my cup NEVER was less than half empty before being topped off. Ditto with my water glass. And this was a busy Saturday AM. If customer service was based on refill status this place would be a 5 star winner.

While coffee and water are 2 key ingredients to recovery one needs the third piece of the puzzle-grease. And you're in luck because this place specializes in that. I'm not saying I have an iron clad stomach but I could see if you are a health nut your belly might not be so happy after the shock. I'm a savory type of girl so piles of eggs and cheese and hash browns with the all important dosing of ketchup and hot sauce over the whole shebang works for me. The "specials" (which I don't think have changed for at least a decade) do in deed have a mattering of a special feel or theme to it. The country scramble (with eggs and ham and a biscuit and gravy) seems intriguing to say the least. I'll save that for a special circumstance morning (starving and wearing comfy pants). 

But enough about breakfast, let's go to the other part of the day, lunch and dinner. I'll start with the namesake Hamburger Haven. The hamburgers are tasty enough but in order to truly live up to the title Haven I'd expect a little more variety. They feature classic options (bacon, cheese, California, etc) but no combination that could be described as memorable. The ingredients are run of the mill but are at least of decent quality. The fries are just passable too. If they really wanted to try and nab the idea of a "Hamburger Haven" maybe they could start doing an extra special type of burger. Come up with a theme burger for the week and change it up every week. I'm not saying twitter because I don't "tweet" but its a thought. 

The majority of the rest of the menu is standard classic diner fare. The options I've tried ranged from ok to I feel like went to someone's mom's house. On a grubbin' scale, I'd put most of the food between a Stouffer's meal and spending the time to cook it yourself at home if you actually had time to go to the grocery store and keep a halfway decently stocked kitchen, which let's be honest no one does. Fairly priced but not the easiest place to park by. Cash only      .
author: Veronica G.

description: Fabulous breakfast!  $3.95 Mimosas!  Great homemade corned beef hash! Tip: don't ask for extra crispy on the hash if you usually do because the default is very crispy. I've been here for breakfast each time I've visited SF (4x in past year) and it's always been great with no lines.  Note: cash only.
author: Roger H.

description: Awful service. The two regular customers coming in after us were served much before us. Besides the unfriendly waiters, the hamburger was ok. I'm not eating here again.
author: Laura K.

description:
(disclaimer: I'm ignoring the fact that they dish up anything but breakfast. Because that is the only time you should come here.)

If this review was on the quality of the food itself, I would probably knock a few stars off. 

But Hamburger Haven is a neighborhood staple, once which must be accepted for exactly what it is; a time machine back to nineteen sixty something that may not pride itself on its eggs benedict but instead on its ability to deliver bottomless cups of so-so coffee (with purchase of meal only), Denny's-style hashbrowns, and the elusive $4.99 breakfast special (M-F until 11am only).

Come on a weekday. Sit at the bar. Bring a newspaper. Drink some coffee. Order the sausage links, not the bacon. Smother your pancakes in artificial syrup. Watch the cook work his griddle magic. Get some sass from the owner. Sometimes that is all you need in a breakfast experience.
author: Lesley P.

description:
Food = good.  Diner style.  Grease involved.

Service = fast and friendly.

Decor = old, hideous, but tolerable.  

My best friend and I go here to grab a quick breakfast or sometimes burgers.  Been here for dinner too...have better selection elsewhere.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I've only had their burgers, and it was pretty good. Seeing the prices on their menu for other stuff, I definitely think it's a good deal. I'm excited to go back and try the breakfast.

The only thing I had a problem with was the lady who took our order. She did not provide good service at all. The rest of the staff seemed to care a bit more... But seeing her without a smile on her face the entire time almost made me lose my appetite. Nonetheless, I don't think that's enough reason to make me not want to come back here.
author: Sara K.

description:
I imagine Jack Nicholson in Five Easy Pieces eating at a place like this. I could even set the scene where he tells the waitress to hold the chicken between her knees in one of the side booths. It's nice to see a diner in the city that still looks the way it did 30 years ago. (since 1968). 
The food is standard, but the cook arranged my bacon and eggs in a tidy formation. Nothing was swimming in grease and prices are inexpensive. The Haven hit the spot before my friends and I went for a drive.
author: Netty L.

description:
DANGER: THIS PLACE MADE US PHYSICALLY ILL!  

This is yet another dud in my search for an awesome neighborhood breakfast joint.  After reading my fellow yelpers reviews I thought I'd give it a shot but what a scary disappointment.

The food tasted fine during breakfast - mediocre but fine for diner food.  And my coffee cup was never empty - also another plus.  But we hadn't even settled the check when both me and my BF were running for the toilet.  

Needless to say - NOT OK!
author: Melissa W.

description:
I wanted to try this place based on the reviews and its proximity, but it was just ok.  For good or for bad, I sat at the counter near the grill, so I witnessed first hand how the food was prepared.  I got the corned beef hash and before ordering, I asked the counterperson (who by the way could use a bit more personaliity and smile once in a while) if it was "hand made or canned".  She told me it was hand made, so I pictured something similar to what I get at Ellas, but this was extremely, extremely dissappointing.  The corn beef hash came in a patty and it wasn't grilled, but deep fried.  Yes, you're reading right - DEEP FRIED.  The eggs were mediocre and the hashbrowns were actually pretty good.  My kids had the pancakes, which were fluffy and looked tasty.  The bacon was decent as well.  Coffee - wait and go to Peetes.  Almost undrinkable.

So, I guess you get what you pay for, but what really grossed me out (which I witnessed first hand) is how much of the food is deep fried in the deep fryer (along with the french fries).  If you order sausage, deep fried.  Pototates - deep fried.  Corn Beef Hash - deep fried.  I was amazed how many items went into that thing.  I thought breakfast foods were supposed to be on the grill??? 

So, the pros - cheap price, neighborhood feel inside.

The cons - counterlady (sorry), deep fried breakfast food, coffee.  Need I say more?

Would I go back?  Yeah, I'll probably give it another shot, but I think I would get the Irish Special (I think that's what it's called).  It was $10, but looked much more edible than our plates.

DO NOT GET THE CORNED BEEF HASH!!
author: J J.

description: I live around the corner from here and go in often.  It is really comfortable and homey.  It has really good breakfasts and burgers and it is really reasonably priced.
author: Susanne R.

description: Not a bad place to stop by for breakfast (can't speak to the quality of the burgers).  The food isn't going to blow you away, but its a cozy spot with friendly service. Recommended
author: Taylor C.

description: One of my favorite places for old-fashion comfort food. Nice divey burger joint. No frills, just the way I like it.
author: Bridget B.

description:
Good solid joint for breakfast. They've been open since before I can remember. When my friend tried to send us to Halfway Cafe for bfast (which is literally half of a cafe) I suggested we relocate here so we could actually have a sitdown meal. 

Can't complain about the prices and there's a good variety of choices. It's also cool that you can take your pick between hash browns or o'brien potatoes. They're also real good about the coffee warmups.

Too bad parking around Clement is such a b**** or else it'd be more of a staple.
author: Torie Y.

description: Just what a breakfast place should be: fast, friendly, and tasty. No attitude at this place, and even the cooks come out from behind the counter to pour coffee and say hello. My blueberry pancakes were spot on.
author: Jessica R.

description:
So I've only been here once but I definitely enjoyed the breakfast. I'm always on the look out for a place to have a nice hangover cure however I am bummed they did not have Chicken Fried Steak. I had a Denver Omelet which was awesome, the egg was fluffy and the vegetables had a nice crunch to them.

Something else I liked is that they gave me Apple Jelly for my toast. I'm used to getting the normal grape, berry, strawberry, etc... Which is all good but trying Apple for a change was great.

Haven't had anything aside from the breakfast so I am not sure how the burgers or dinner, etc are. I'd imagine with 'Hamburger' being in the name they may know how to hook one up pretty decent.

I'll definitely be hitting this place back up.
author: Seth H.

description: I adore this place. I'm from Texas and have lived in San Francisco for the last 5 years and have found it very difficult to find reasonably priced, good comfort food. I come here for the biscuits and gravy EVERY time. I usually get two servings and it's fantastically cheap. I love the unpretentious feel of the place. It is a diner that isn't using the word diner as a gimmick.
author: Angela S.

description: I cannot stress the importance of cheap breakfast, both for the financially challenged and the hungover alike.  Hamburger Haven is the greasy spoon beacon of Clement St., and their "What kind of pig would you like with your eggs?" approach to breakfast always hits the spot.  They're a lot like The Stooges: Nothing fancy, but you know you're going to leave both satisfied and violated.
author: Michael D.

description: Come to eat breakfast at least once a week here with my family. I love their Eggs Benedict! The eggs are cooked perfectly and the service is pretty good here. The staff are friendly and I love the vibe.
author: Veronica C.

description: The 70's orange tile atmosphere and nice waitress were great.  The heated frozen burger patties were pretty mediocre.  Still it was cheap.
author: Cork C.

description: I've reviewed this place before and it's one of my favorites, but gosh the last few times i've been here have been unpleasant.  One night, I came with my girl (she didn't even want to come here) and the older asian woman who was our waitress was extremely rude, just walking away while we were still speaking...etc.  I mean that was just embarassing for me cuz i really wanted us to have a good time there.  I went back on Monday morning and of course the grumpy asian lady was working.  For starters, my coffee mug was dirty and i asked the waitress to give me a new one.  I thought i had asked pretty politely but apparently she took offense and was very rude and took her sweet time getting me a new mug.  She was very rude taking my order, and i just feel like that woman really brings the vibe down.  Management please have a talk with her!!! i love hamburger haven too much to not return!
author: Damien R.

description: Not a pretty joint but breakfast is made just right every single time.  We like sitting at the counter just  because we like watching the food get cooked.  The cook hardly ever smiles but is meticulous and clean.  By the way, awesome hash browns.
author: Emy B.

description: Well... the food is a 3 - a decent grade of diner food.  But I'm going to give an extra [star] for the  homie environment - the waitress was quite hospitable and the decor took me back - I could envision a quentin tarantino film being shot here... with all the extras being asian (just pull them freely from the street...) - a classic american diner in a chinatown-ish district - quite the gem.
author: Gerald F.

description:
Okay, this place is not half-bad. I love diner food and to be honest, there aren't a whole lot of places in SF that cater to that. Most places are pretty frou-frou. Hamburger Haven has a way of hitting that spot when you're craving some hash browns and bacon (so, for me, like every day. Luckily, I don't always indulge.) and just some regular, hearty food.

I remember coming to this place a few times when I was a kid. This place feels exactly the same. It's got this authentic, old-timey vibe. It's the kind of place where you get called "hun" or "sweetie." You can tell that many patrons are regulars. Plus points here. Our server (and, I suspect, owner) was really attentive and attempted to refill the coffee cup like 10 times.

We came here on our way up to Napa Valley for the weekend. Breakfast special for $5? I vote "yea" on that!  Nice, well-done hash browns, just like I ordered them, and lean bacon....what more could a girl want?
author: Tiffany L.

description: Its been years since ive been to HH. I used to work across the street.  Standard greasy spoon diner.  But the fact that its been at its location for so many years is some testament to quality - or its customers lack of imagination - not sure which. Should re visit soon.
author: Oleg H.

description:
